result.execSummary:
The defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by the end of supervision in case 14CF5430.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Bail to apply if applicable.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 4 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision in case# 14CF5430.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. sab
Matter in Court on defendant's violation report. Court sets bail at $25.00 cash.

Defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/27/2015 at 1:30 pm.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse. Court orders the defendant back to Justice Point for monitoring with all the previously ordered conditions.

Defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for plea/sentencing on 7/20/15 in Branch 15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Clemont Tramell Fondren in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
